item.description: Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#1338; 07:33PM; 19031 W Bessemer St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3T5eZb8; #Tarzana; First arriving 20 LAFD Firefighters took less than 10 minutes to access, confine and fully extinguish an outside fire that extended to the porch and within one room of a one-story 1,532 square-foot home. No injury. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 93; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC17 E100 E273 E293 RA73 T73 T93; CH9; 17; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#1338; 07:23PM; 19031 W Bessemer St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3T5eZb8; #Tarzana; PRELIM: Outside fire extended to the rear of a one story home. ; FS 93; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC17 E100 E273 E293 RA73 T73 T93; CH9; 17; Brian Humphrey

Complete - Hazardous Materials Investigation; INC#0468; 10:45AM; 6255 W Sunset Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3S3c8y4; #Hollywood; LAFD personnel, including a Hazardous Materials experts, determined that an unspecified quantity of oil-based refrigerant had leaked on the 14th floor of the 21 story office building, leading to the calm and orderly evacuation of all (undetermined number) building occupants, none of whom reported injury or illness. The scene has been stabilized, and there is no off-site or escalating hazard. Building occupants will be allowed to reoccupy the majority of the structure, and County Health officials have been notified to coordinate clean-up of the immediately involved area.; FS 27; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC5 E21 E221 E227 E261 E29 E82 EM11 JT1 RA82 RA827 SQ21 T21 T27 T61; CH7; 13 15; Brian Humphrey

Hazardous Materials investigation; INC#0468; 09:25AM; 6255 W Sunset Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3S3c8y4; #Hollywood; PRELIM: LAFD crews evaluating possible refrigerant leak on the roof of a 21 story office building. No injuries reported.; FS 27; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC5 E21 E221 E227 E261 E29 E82 EM11 JT1 RA82 RA827 SQ21 T21 T27 T61; CH7; 13 15; Brian Humphrey

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0079; 02:13AM; 1654 W 20th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Clctb3; Pico-Union; KNOCKDOWN: 42 firefighters extinguished the fire in 30 minutes with no injuries reported. Heavy fire on the 2nd floor extended into the attic. There were no injuries reported. Cause of the fire is TBD. No further details.; FS 13; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC1 BC11 BC18 CM20 CM22 E10 E13 E15 E203 E211 E215 E226 E26 E3 EM11 HR3 RA15 RA26 RA3 RA803 RA813 T11 T15 T26 T3 UR3 UR88; CH9; 13 14; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#0079; 01:43AM; 1650 W 20th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3EAcFob; Pico-Union; Two story (vacant) apartment building with heavy fire showing on the 2nd floor. Firefighters are in the offensive mode. Additional resources were requested and shown in this alert.; FS 13; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC1 BC11 BC18 CM20 CM22 E10 E13 E15 E203 E211 E215 E226 E26 E3 EM11 HR3 RA15 RA26 RA3 RA803 RA813 T11 T15 T26 T3 UR3 UR88; CH9; 13 14; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1662; 08:54PM; 956 N Hoover St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3TeDTVA; Silver Lake; KNOCKDOWN: 36 firefighters achieved a knockdown in 17 minutes with no injuries reported. One adult male was evacuated from the 1st floor unit as firefighters ascended to the 2nd floor, located the fire in a small laundry room and quickly extinguished it. A primary and secondary search did not locate any occupants in the unit. Cause and $ loss TBD. No further details.; FS 35; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC5 E20 E220 E235 E35 E56 E6 RA52 RA82 T20 T35; CH9; 13; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#1662; 08:37PM; 956 N Hoover St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3TeDTVA; Silver Lake; Two story duplex with fire on the 2nd floor. Firefighters are in the offensive mode. The first floor is occupied and being evacuated. No one has yet been located on the fire floor. ; FS 35; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC5 E20 E235 E35 E6 RA52 RA82 T35; CH9; 13; Margaret Stewart

Update Structure Fire; INC#1068; 07:11PM; 7056 N Van Nuys Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3yzNr5A; Van Nuys; While an official "Knockdown" has not yet been declared, the Incident Commander had the incident timer (tracking the length of the incident) turned off as they continue to dismantle the building with the heavy equipment so they can fully extinguish all small pockets of fire. There were no further injuries reported (one firefighter transported in fair condition with a (non-traumatic) medical complaint (heat exhaustion). LAFD Arson section is conducting the investigation per protocol for an incident of this size. Crews will remain on scene throughout the night and there will be visible flames on the debris pile which will be controlled - there is no need to be concerned or contact 9-1-1. No further details and no further updates are anticipated. ; FS 39; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; AR1 AR33 AR7 BC10 BC14 BC15 BC17 BC5 CE84 CM40 CM42 E100 E102 E20 E275 E278 E287 E288 E289 E290 E298 E37 E39 E7 E81 E89 E90 E98 EA1 EM10 EM14 HE1 HR3 PI4 PI5 RA60 RA7 RA839 RA89 RA99 RS3 T60 T75 T78 T87 T88 T89 T90 T98 UR88 UR89; CH9; 13 17; Margaret Stewart

Update Structure Fire; INC#1068; 04:38PM; 7056 N Van Nuys Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3yzNr5A; Van Nuys; Over 85 firefighters remain in the defensive mode. One firefighter is being evaluated and transported for a non-life threatening medical complaint (no trauma injury). Firefighters have successfully contained the blaze to the fire building of origin, defending the two adjacent buildings. There is heavy smoke blanketing the area and neighbors are advised to remain indoors with doors/windows closed. Power was shut off to the block which caused 'stuck elevators' in a nearby assisted living facility. A full task force (10 firefighters) is at the facility handling the situation. The media staging is established at Van Nuys x Vose St with Captain Jacob Raabe #mediastaging #mediaalert This will continue to be an extended operation due to the amount of fire and accessing those pockets to achieve full extinguishment. Per protocol, LAFD Arson is responding for the investigation. No further details.; FS 39; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; AR1 AR33 AR7 BC10 BC14 BC15 BC17 BC5 CE84 CM40 CM42 E100 E102 E20 E275 E278 E287 E288 E289 E290 E298 E37 E39 E7 E81 E89 E90 E98 EA1 EM10 EM14 HR3 PI4 PI5 RA60 RA7 RA839 RA99 RS3 T60 T75 T78 T87 T88 T89 T90 T98 UR88 UR89; CH9; 13 17; Margaret Stewart
